subject: Re: [junit] JUNIT - TestSuites
msgSnippet: brainbug, I have to admit that I m pretty confused by this report.  Two suggestions: 1) Any chance you could write a JUnit test that fails, showing the exact
messageBody:
brainbug,

I have to admit that I'm pretty confused by this report. Two suggestions:

1) Any chance you could write a JUnit test that fails, showing the exact
behavior you expect?
2) Have you tried stepping through with a debugger?

I'm guessing that there's a bug in the logic that has nothing to do with the
internal behavior of JUnit or TestSuite. Good luck,

David Saff

On 11/8/06, brainbug_dd <brainbug_dd@...> wrote:
>
> This doesn't work.
>
> INFO:
> testname.size()= 3
> stepsPerTest = [3, 2, 1]
> inputCountForStep = [3, 2, 2, 3, 3, 1]
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> TestSuite mySuite = new TestSuite( "MY TESTSUITE" );
>
> Vector<TestSuite> suiteForTests = new Vector<TestSuite>();
> Vector<TestSuite> suiteForSteps = new Vector<TestSuite>();
>
> for( int k = 0; k < testname.size(); k++ )
> {
> TestSuite temp1 = new TestSuite( "Test : " + testname.elementAt( k ) );
> suiteForTests.addElement( temp1 );
> mySuite.addTest( suiteForTests.elementAt( k ) );
>
> for( int i = 0; i < stepsPerTest.elementAt( k); i++ )
> {
> TestSuite temp2 = new TestSuite( "Step : " +
> (testname.elementAt( k )));
> suiteForSteps.addElement( temp2 );
> temp2=null;
> suiteForTests.elementAt( k ).addTest(
> suiteForSteps.elementAt( i) );
>
> for( int j = 0; j < inputCountForStep().elementAt( i ); j++ )
> {
> suiteForSteps.elementAt( i ).addTest(
> new Tests( k + "-"+ i+"-"+ j));
> }
> }
> }
> ----------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> In the Second-Loop the line:
> TestSuite temp2 = new TestSuite( "Step : " + (testname.elementAt( k )));
>
> there is always an Error. the k represent always the Element for
> testname.elementAt( 0 )
>
> I don't know, what I do wrong.
>
>
>
